result.execSummary:
The defendant Jerad A Schneider was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Jerad A Schneider is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Jerad A Schneider was found guilty of Manuf/Deliver Schedule I, II Narcotics, a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Forest County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Credit for 1 day only if revoked (stipulated).

miscConds.notes:
The defendant must maintain/obtain full time employment/school that consists of at least 35 hrs/week.

When not full time employed/school, the defendant must apply for at least 3 jobs per week and report progress monthly to P&P with pertinent information in regards to applications.  The defendant must only apply for jobs qualified for - must accept any job offered - must not engage in any conduct that could result in the termination of his/her employment/school.

The defendant must follow thru with all recommendations and plan that is already established due to his outpatient treatment.

The defendant must attend at least one AA/NA meeting each week.
No possession or consumption of alcohol and no entry into any bars or taverns.
The defendant must submit a DNA sample.

timeConds.notes: Huber allowed - eligible for community service under 973.09(7m).

10 hours of community service per month but not leess than 100 total hours of community service within the 3 years of probation.

As deemed appropriate by P&P.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jerad A Schneider

records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations
Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Order Collection Biological Specimen DNA Analysis

records.addlTxt: Letter and documents from Peaceful Solutions Counseling

Defendant Jerad A Schneider in court with attorney Henry Reid Schultz.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 3:19 PM. State - here for sentencing. Discussion on whether the remaining counts were to be dismissed or dismissed and read in. Schultz explains to his client that the agreement was for the other counts to be DRI. Court will consider counts #2 thru #6 to be DRI. State makes final argument prior to recommendation - recommends 3 years probation with conditions of probation as follows: 365 days in FC jail, $500.00 fine plus costs and surcharges, AODA, reimburse FCDTF the amount of $360.00, maintain absolute sobriety, no possession of alcohol and no entry into any bars, taverns or similar establishments, employment/school, 300 hours of community service. Schultz makes final argument prior to sentencing - provides court with information on the outpatient treatment that the defendant participated in - recommends 4 months or less of conditional jail and 100 hours of community service. Schneider makes statement, remorseful. Court sentences the defendant to the following: count #1 - with hold sentence and place on probation for 3 years with conditions of: $500.00 fine plus costs and surcharges - take bond posted - remainder due thru probation, follow thru with all recommendations and plan that is already established due to his outpatient treatment, attend at least one AA/NA meeting each week, reimburse FCDTP of $360.00, maintain/obtain full time employment/school, no consumption of possession of alcohol and no entry into any bar or tavern, 10 hours of community service per month but not less than 100 total hours of community service within the 3 years, 8 months in FC jail - huber allowed - eligible for community service under 973.09(7m) - report today - credit for 1 day only if revoked (stipulated), submit DNA sample, no possession of firearms, no voting rights, right to appeal, adjourned.
Sentencing hearing on June 29, 2016 at 03:15 pm.
Sentencing hearing on May 23, 2016 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Jerad A Schneider in court with attorney Henry Reid Schultz.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 10:03 AM. State - resolved - defendant would plead G to count #1 on amended information, remaining counts #2 thru #6 would be DRI, joint recommendation of 3 years probation with free to argue on jail time/prison time, defendant would like sentencing date. Schneider and Schultz agree. Court dismisses counts #2, #3, #4, #5 and #6. Schneider pleads G to count #1 as alleged. Courts sets for sentencing hearing, continues bond.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for May 23, 2016 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Jerad A Schneider in court with attorney Henry Reid Schultz.  Jodie L. Bednar appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called 2:38 PM. Schultz has handed court waiver of PH. State has filed information which the charges are the same just deleting repeater allegations and name is spelled correctly. Court goes over waiver of PH form with defendant and finds defendant is freely waiving his right to preliminary hearing, court finds probable cause and binds over for trial. Schultz has copy of Information and waives further reading, enters NG pleas. Schneider agrees. Schultz asks for bond to be reduced to $500 cash. Court modifies bond to $500 cash. Balance to be refunded to poster.  No consumption of alcohol. Final pre-trial scheduled for April 25, 2016 at 10:00 am.

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt: Defendant Jerad A Schneider in court with attorney Henry Reid Schultz who appears telephonically with leave of the Court.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 3:40 PM. Schultz and Schneider have complaint, waives reading of it, requests PH and will waive time limits for PH. Court considers time limits waived, continues bond, set for PH.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 8, 2016 at 02:00 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Jerad A Schneider
Current: 815 Pardee Street, Wausau, WI 54401 United States  (Effective: 01-18-2016)
Prior: 5272 County Road S, Crandon, WI 54520

Defendant Jared A Schneider appears via video from FOSO, in custody.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called 2:02 PM. Defendant has copy of complaint. Court reads charges, penalties and right to an attorney. Defendant understands but states he is not a repeater and feels the complaint is incorrect. State agrees and states the complaint is incorrect and will file an amended complaint. Schneider would like an attorney. Court advises of court appointed attorney. Burns interupts court and states if he looses his job he may be able to appointed by SPD. State requests $2500 cash bond for stated reasons. Court - $2500 cash bond. No consumption of alcohol. Mother is in court and indicates she will be posting today.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for January 27, 2016 at 03:30 pm.
